item.title: 苏丹公民数月来一直指责外部世界遗忘了一场内战，这场内战引发了大量战争罪行指控，在此之后，美国任命了一名新官员
item.description:
A new US appointment has come after months of accusations by Sudanese citizens that the outside world has forgotten a civil war that has unleashed a torrent of alleged war crimes https://t.co/AZK8MXrpEJ pic.twitter.com/1bBrU5gkTo

— Financial Times (@FT) February 28, 2024

item.title: 如果您今天只读了一件事，那就是：《金融时报》视觉叙事团队的又一杰作，这一次是对现代世界最重要的物品之一--微型芯片--的一次彻底的心灵探索。
item.description:
If you read one thing today make it this:

Another masterpiece from the FT’s visual storytelling team, this time a thoroughly mind-expanding dive into one of the modern world’s most important objects: the microchip https://t.co/RqkOsWriYh

— John Burn-Murdoch (@jburnmurdoch) February 28, 2024

item.title: 亚马逊的 10 亿美元工业创新基金将加大对人工智能和机器人技术公司的投资，这家电子商务巨头正努力提高其物流网络的效率。
item.description:
Amazon’s $1bn industrial innovation fund is to step up investments in companies that combine artificial intelligence and robotics, as the ecommerce giant seeks to drive efficiencies across its logistics network https://t.co/4sa6sHOHae pic.twitter.com/lFrCevVn41

— Financial Times (@FT) February 28, 2024

item.title: 2012 年，普京和习近平开始结成 "无限制 "伙伴关系。但这并不妨碍俄罗斯演练防御中国入侵的措施--包括使用核武器，而且使用核武器的门槛比克里姆林宫承认的要低得多。
item.description:
In 2012, Putin and Xi began forming their “no limits” partnership.

That didn’t stop Russia rehearsing a defense against a Chinese invasion – including using nuclear weapons at a much lower threshold than the Kremlin has ever admitted.

with @xtophercook https://t.co/z9NPr5khbF

— max seddon (@maxseddon) February 28, 2024

item.title: 据审查和核实文件的专家称，机密文件描述的使用战术核武器的门槛比俄罗斯公开承认的要低
item.description:
Classified papers describe a threshold for using tactical nuclear weapons that is lower than Russia has ever publicly admitted, according to experts who reviewed and verified the documents https://t.co/lSTkHuosgZ pic.twitter.com/GuDwiLh9NB

— Financial Times (@FT) February 28, 2024

item.title: 芯片制造商必须以前所未有的方式重新思考半导体架构--公司的技术声誉和财务状况取决于是否下了正确的赌注
item.description:
Chipmakers are having to rethink semiconductor architecture like never before — and the technological reputation and financial standing of companies depends on the right bets being made https://t.co/ytKo64gIJh pic.twitter.com/JqZIbKwWZa

— Financial Times (@FT) February 28, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯判处著名人权活动家奥列格-奥尔洛夫（Oleg Orlov）两年半监禁，这是弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）总统日益残酷镇压批评其政权的人士的最新迹象。@courtney_ft 为您报道详情：
item.description:
Russia has sentenced prominent human rights activist Oleg Orlov to two-and-a-half years in prison, in the latest sign of President Vladimir Putin’s increasingly brutal crackdown on critics of his regime. ⁦@courtney_ft⁩ has the details: https://t.co/4JZe7YxJtH

— max seddon (@maxseddon) February 27, 2024

item.title: 我们最新的视觉故事：世界上最小的微型芯片的制造过程：@samjoiner @upyorkshire @Dan_Clark5 @inari_ta @BobHaslett
item.description:
Our latest visual story on the process of manufacturing the world's smallest microchips:https://t.co/ULohMSkkoe

w/ @samjoiner @upyorkshire @Dan_Clark5 @inari_ta @BobHaslett pic.twitter.com/F7c3HhmJXI

— Sam Learner (@sam_learner) February 28, 2024

item.title: 缩小计算机芯片是人类最伟大的科学成就之一，它使我们生活的方方面面都实现了数字化。但现在，芯片制造商不得不以前所未有的方式重新思考半导体架构
item.description:
Shrinking the computer chip is one of humanity’s greatest scientific feats, leading to the digitalisation of every aspect of our lives.

But now chipmakers are having to rethink semiconductor architecture like never before https://t.co/oZdf3PPXXL pic.twitter.com/0BQk15kY5O

— Financial Times (@FT) February 28, 2024

item.title: 新：我们最新的视觉故事解释了现代芯片制造的奇迹--以及为什么在追求性能和利润的竞争中，工程师们正在前所未有地重新思考芯片架构W/@upyorkshire @Dan_Clark5 @inari_ta @sam_learner @BobHaslett👉
item.description:
